duck: The chlorinity of water is defined as the mass of chlorine equivalent to the total mass of halogen contained in 1 kg seawater.
chlorinity definition: a measure of the concentration of halides in one kilogram of seawater.

wiki.text:
The 'chlorinity' of water is defined as the mass of chlorine equivalent to the
total mass of halogen contained in 1 kg seawater. It is determined by the Mohr-
Knudsen titration, which however neglects fluoride.

The halogen concentration of sea water can be expressed in terms of 'chlorosity'
which is the number of grams of chloride and chloride equivalents to the bromide
in one liter of sea water at .

Chlorinity is related to chlorosity as:

Chlorinity(<sup>o</sup>/<sub>oo</sub>) = chlorosity/density of the sample.

Chorinity is related to salinity as:

Salinity(<sup>o</sup>/<sub>oo</sub>) = 0.03 + 1.805 x chlorinity.
wiki.title: chlorinity
